channel.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
channel.description:
http://www.callofduty.com/xp http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Txu2w5ceVY
Immerse yourself in the game you love at the first ever Call of Duty® XP, the ultimate Call of Duty® experience. From our million-dollar tournament, the chance to play Modern Warfare® 3 two months early, the ultimate paintball firefight on a life-size re-creation of Scrapyard, the spectacle of running the Pit, and the reveal of the innovative features of Call of Duty®: Elite, this epic event brings Call of Duty® to life. Anyone that can’t be there but wants to connect to the action can link up through our numerous broadcast outlets. Your Call of Duty experience is about to get real.
Paintball on a scaled model of the mw2 map Scrapyard, Burger Town, The Pit, Ziplines... What else could you want!?! I know most of you are CSS or BF3 fans but do you see EA Games throwing out live action events?

item.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Yeh, that is a bit of a piss take. I was in a MW2 game the other day when some guy used a “Banana cream pie injection”. Had a quick google and couldn’t find anything, anyone got any info on this by chance?

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Frell:

They didn’t listen to anyone after the COD 4 problems

Also, Cod4 + Cod WaW are both hacked, 85% of the games you get in are modded games, everyone cheats for prestiges + weapons.

None of the Cod 4 glitches ever got patched.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

For them to “fix” 2+ year old games would be illogical, they’d lose money.

Releasing map packs/other promotions is the only way they can continue to make money from the franchise. If you don’t like their games, don’t buy. Shimples.

Personally, I’ve enjoyed playing all the CoD games, besides Waw and Black Ops. Anyway, BF3 should hopefully dick all over CoD.

Read full topic

Mr.Chris:

Frell mad cos a business wanna make sum monies.

It went from COD 4, 1 800 mappack to Black Ops, COD elite, and 3 $20 map packs.

item.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Frell:

Activision can fuck off, they’ve ran call of duty into the ground and are milking out profits through promotions rather than fixing the game.

They’re spending 1 million dollars on this project… plus fixing the game is SledgeHammers, Infinity Ward and who ever else was the other developer was job

item.title: Call of Duty XP 2011
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Call of Duty

Call of Duty® XP 2016

Call of Duty® XP 2016 is coming! Call of Duty® XP is the ultimate Call of Duty® experience for any fan of the franchise and a celebration of our passionate community.


Immerse yourself in the game you love at the first ever Call of Duty® XP, the ultimate Call of Duty® experience. From our million-dollar tournament, the chance to play Modern Warfare® 3 two months early, the ultimate paintball firefight on a life-size re-creation of Scrapyard, the spectacle of running the Pit, and the reveal of the innovative features of Call of Duty®: Elite, this epic event brings Call of Duty® to life. Anyone that can’t be there but wants to connect to the action can link up through our numerous broadcast outlets. Your Call of Duty experience is about to get real.

Paintball on a scaled model of the mw2 map Scrapyard, Burger Town, The Pit, Ziplines… What else could you want!?!

I know most of you are CSS or BF3 fans but do you see EA Games throwing out live action events?
